member.name: N:IBM.CTG
member.summary: Contains classes for accessing CICS servers using the CICS Transaction Gateway.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.EciExtendMode
member.summary: Specifies whether an should start, continue, or end a logical unit of work (LUW).

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciExtendMode.EciNoExtend
member.summary: Execute the request and commit all changes to recoverable resources.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciExtendMode.EciExtended
member.summary: If is zero, start a new logical unit of work (LUW). Otherwise execute the request within an existing LUW.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciExtendMode.EciCommit
member.summary: Terminate the logical unit of work (LUW), committing all changes to recoverable resources.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciExtendMode.EciBackOut
member.summary: Terminate the logical unit of work (LUW), backing out all changes to recoverable resources.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode
member.summary: Defines return codes returned by a Gateway daemon.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgNoError
member.summary: No error.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrUnknownRequestType
member.summary: Obsolete. No longer used.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrGatewayClosed
member.summary: The Gateway daemon is closing.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrWorkWasRefused
member.summary: The Gateway daemon refused the request because no worker threads were available or the Gateway daemon is closing.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrExceptionInGateway
member.summary: An exception occurred in the Gateway daemon.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrGatewayBackLevel
member.summary: The connection failed because the Gateway daemon is at an earlier product release than the Client application.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrInvalidRequestType
member.summary: The protocol handler for the port that the Client application is connected to does not accept the request type sent. This can occur if your application connects to the Gateway daemon statistics port instead of the TCP/IP port.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.GatewayReturnCode.CtgErrSystemError
member.summary: An internal system error occurred. If the problem persists, collect application and Gateway daemon trace and contact your IBM service representative.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode
member.summary: Defines External Call Interface (ECI) return codes.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrRolledBack
member.summary: An attempt was made to commit a logical unit of work, but the CICS server was unable to commit the changes, and backed them out instead.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrMaxSessions
member.summary: There are insufficient communication resources to complete the request.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrMaxSystems
member.summary: The CICS TG has reached its limit on the maximum number of CICS servers.

member.summary: An invalid combination of and was specified.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrUnknownServer
member.summary: The target CICS server is unknown to the Gateway daemon.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrResourceShortage

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciErrLuwToken
member.summary: The property is not valid. There is no active unit of work associated with the specified LUW token.

member.summary: The property is not valid. There is no active unit of work associated with the specified LUW token.

member.summary:
The ECI request contains a and the destination CICS server is not a defined IPIC server. -or-

member.summary: The CICS transaction abended. The abend code is available in the property.

member.summary: The ECI call timed out while waiting for a response.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.EciReturnCode.EciNoError

member.summary: The user ID is not known to the External Security Manager.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel
member.summary: Defines trace levels for IBM.CTG.Client.dll.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel.CtgTrcDisabled
member.summary: Disables tracing.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel.CtgTrcLevel1
member.summary: Includes exception trace points only.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel.CtgTrcLevel2
member.summary: Includes event trace points and all CtgTrcLevel1 trace points.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel.CtgTrcLevel3
member.summary: Includes function entry and exit trace points and all CtgTrcLevel1 and CtgTrcLevel2 trace points.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.TraceLevel.CtgTrcLevel4
member.summary: Includes debug trace points and all CtgTrcLevel1, CtgTrcLevel2 and CtgTrcLevel3 trace points.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.ContainerType
member.summary: Defines the data type held within a .

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.ContainerType.BIT
member.summary: The type for a holding binary data.

member.name: F:IBM.CTG.ContainerType.CHAR
member.summary: The type for a holding character data.

member.name: T:IBM.CTG.Trace
member.summary: Provides methods for controlling trace in IBM.CTG.Client.dll.

member.name: P:IBM.CTG.Trace.TraceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the trace level.

member.name: P:IBM.CTG.Trace.DataDumpLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of data traced in each data block at .

member.name: P:IBM.CTG.Trace.DataDumpOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting offset in each data blocks when tracing at .

member.name: M:IBM.CTG.Trace.SetTraceFile(System.String)
member.summary: This method is obsolete and should no longer be used.
member.param: The name of the file to use for ctgclient.dll trace, or to revert to the standard error output stream.
member.exception: The trace file could not be created at the specified location.
